HTML Block and Inline Elements Previous Next Every HTML element has a default display value, depending on what type of element it is. The two most common display values are block and inline. Block-level Elements A block-level element always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element. A block-level element always takes up the full width available (stretches out to the left and right as far as it can). Two commonly used block elements are:

and

. The

element defines a paragraph in an HTML document. The

element defines a division or a section in an HTML document. The

element is a block-level element. The
